reviewText:
I waited a little to review this. Got a few hours under my belt of playing so I guess it's a good time.

What makes this game fun?

-Guns. Lots of guns. For lack of better description, it's diablo with guns set in a apocalyptic world.
-Unintentional Humor. The poor translating of the game text has caused for some hilarious quotes from NPCs.
-Community. The number of people playing isn't huge which could be a negative, if it didn't cause for creating a very tight nit like community where a lot of people know each other and know of each other causing the game to feel more friendly and rewarding to log onto. It's kind of like that bar in Cheers. You want to go where everybody knows your name.
-Music. The soundtrack for the game is actually pretty good. I enjoy it a lot.

What makes the game kinda hard/boring/ maybe bad?

-Grindy. While I don't mind, some people might find the game grindy and boring because of it. Once you hit level 50 you kind of run out of quests to do and have to grind dailies and just mobs to get xp to get to the cap level of 60. Kinda rough, but some people actually enjoy this.
-Limitation to your character. Nobody really tells you when you start to watch how you spend your skill points because when you want to respec, you will have to pay real money or start over new character. Well now you know, so maybe it takes one bad thing away.
-Outdated Graphics. Once again, something that doesn't bother me, but might others. A lot of people seem to voice concern of the graphics looking similiar to that of the original Diablo, which can be said they are poor and outdated. However in the time and age of nostalgia, where people are playing 8 bit games on super gaming PCs and not complaining, this seems like a ♥♥♥♥ poor excuse to complain about a game.

Overall. This game is super fun and can get you hooked if you're into this style of games. At the same time, it's not a cup of tea for everyone to share, so give it a try and see if you enjoy the sip.

I like the wasd controls, which let me do strafe firing. Thank god it's not mouse only movement like diablo. This game is simple/easy but addicting because of the loot mechanics where any mob can drop legendaries(although rare), unlike some other mmos(i'm looking at you Defiance). The only quick travel available is to go back to main town, not the other way around. At level 16 make sure you get the free vechicle in town so you won't bored out of your mind traveling to far places.
Anyhow, It's great so far and I've gotten 3 chars to level 20 (max is way above, i 50+?).
The cash shop provides boost(exp, luck) and custom clothes. I haven't tried pvp yet since I'm a pve player,.. even then this game would last you a long time, it gets a little grindy after lev 30, then again many mmos get grindy at later levels.

reviewText:
TL;DR
--------
A fun, casual game for those looking to just relax and mess around. Can provide hours of gameplay since it's a dungeon crawler with varying classes that may use certain weapons. The translation is laughably bad, and the story isn't that really interesting. There's nothing special with the Cash Shop nor is there anything worth buying really, since inventory and bank space can be bought with in-game currency. Fun to play alone, or with friends.

Pros:
--------
- Fun and casual game for those not looking to play something hardcore and just want to kill time / relax on.
- Simple and easy controls / combat / UI
- Casual drop tables, meaning that rare items and up will drop often if you spend some time playing the game, rewarding players for just playing and killing mobs.
- Free mount at lvl 16
- Free gifts just for staying logged in
- Doesn't require a strong computer, so lower-end computer uses can enjoy the game as well
- Instanced missions that can be done with other players and will always give rare rewards at the end depending on how many points the entire team scored.
- Plethora of weapons to use, including chainsaws, rocket launchers and heavy machine guns
- Character customization and wearable armors to make your character look unique to others.
- Can buy more inventory and bank space with in-game currency (CRI).
- Game is not Pay 2 Win
- You can recall back to town, and teleport back to your previous location via the helicopter

Cons:
--------
- Cash shop at the moment doesn't really have anything appealing to buy (Mostly just mounts, costumes, and %magic find potions).
- Hilariously awful translations
- I have no idea what's happening in the story nor do I care
- Game is probably TOO easy for those looking for a challenging dungeon crawler
- Have to buy ammo (but it's cheap and can be found off mobs)

Graphics wise I didn't mess with any settings but on default it looks fine, not spectacular but few isometric games really stand out in this department.

If you enjoy MMOs and classic isometric RPGs then I'd give this game a try since it's free and the download is only around 1,5 gb.

predator (mage) that uses minigun and rocket launcher,
and sniper (archer) that uses sniper rifle.
Each branch also has different skills/abilities with the usual skill tree and active/passive abilities unlocked by skill points.

There's a durability system, but it's pretty minor cost to repair, and it takes a while to lose it.
The tutorial weapon reward is a durability weapon that doesn't use ammo but durability (since it's like a temp weapon), but any other gun/armor, you can just repair and keep using.

There is a ammo system, but guns have a high max ammo amount,
and you can keep three guns types (with all different ammo types) equipped on your character to easily switch from (with hotkeys), and any other guns in your inventory to equip when you want.
Ammo can last a while if you use different guns, and the return to town skill has a 1 min cooldown, so it's not a big deal.

Armor you find actually changes the character's look, with different colors, too.
(Which is really nice, don't know how many games I liked that you couldn't effect the character's look with the armor you found/equipped).

Shooting/blowing up enemies or killing them with skills, is really satisfying.

So to sum it up, it's a fun hack&slash with some rpg.

WoW-style servers where everyone shares one world with different maps for each area.
Diablo-style graphics, loot, and camera angles.
Similar playstyle as the arcade zombies from call of duty.

It's if Diablo 2 met Diablo 3 and they had a baby: if you are in a party (which goes up to 3 players unless your in a special mission), then there is a shared loot system. If you are not in a party, other players in your server can see your drops - but they cant pick them up. Nothing is bound on pickup other than items from quests ONLY. Most rare/super rare/legendary/set items are bind on equip, which means... you guessed it...

-Graphics are horrendous to the point where even a well-made modern smart phone game would easily topple Metal Reaper in terms of aesthetics. The launcher would advertise all the classic sexy bunny and maid costumes worn by... Half disfigured women whose faces were comprised of a grand total of 5 polygons.

A better lightning may have helped hide some of the ugliest textures, but since more than half of the stages takes place in daylight, you will have the uncanny chance to enjoy the vast and colorful wastelands of the Nix Empire at full view!




-English is... Oh.
Having korean origins myself, I know for a fact they absolutely hate using google translate or the likes, leading to have million wons-costing huge neon signs mispelled in ways that would make you lose sight, not because it was too bright, but because you have yourself decided to gouge your eyes out, an almost natural reflex man would have when, for example, one is facing an ancient god of the depths in its wake.

Then again, you will most likely not bother reading the quests because of how generic they are. And it's far from being broken to the point where you can't understand ♥♥♥♥. reviewText:
A perfect example of free to play at it's worst.

This is a game with a lot of potential and I've had a bit of fun playing it.  It's not without a few problems; poor localization, occasional bugs, and limited ability to configure the ui.  Still, these can be forgiven and don't detract too much from the game itself.

They imply that a pay to win costume and some xp increases is the same as the Dragonborn dlc in Skyrim or Old World Blues in New Vegas.  You're paying more for this pay to win dlc" then many games in their entirety.

At best this serves as a display that these kinds of games are still in demand.  Perhaps some other publisher can pick this up and salvage the situation
date: but for now this is a game to be wary of.  You may have some fun here

reviewText:
A fun, but slightly glitchy/laggy shoot&loot. Fair, easy to get into, not badly pay to win, and easy to play with friends. Progression is gradual and never leaves you starved for things to do, and the class system is fun and easy to grasp. Imagine Runescape with guns. The translations are pretty bad, but the game is legible and the quests are self-explainatory enough that it doesn't take away from anything. Lots of variety and weapons, fun customization options. The quests do start to feel a lot of the same after a while, but the gameplay is fluid enough that it'll keep your attention longer than a lot of other free to plays.

Pros
+Easy to understand, easy to grasp, easy to follow
+Dungeons, missions and lengthy story
+Fun to explore, maps are varied
+Not pay to win
+Small download, easy to run on most computers
+Looting is fun and rewarding, you never feel like you can't get your hands on something you want
+Good customization and weapons list.

Cons
-Bad translation, feels like the dev threw it in google translate and called it done.
-Quests can get repititive.
-Sometimes glitchy, many enemies on screen at once generates copious lag in some places.


VERDICT: 8/10
